alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 9:08AM AKST until December 29 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow occuring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches expected. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys. * WHEN...Until 6 PM today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 30 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
